intro: Goniothalamus dispermus, commonly known as the two-seeded goniothalamus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Annonaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and is typically found in lowland rainforests. It produces two seeds per fruit, which is a distinguishing feature of its name. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
